message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.GT, cs.CR, cs.MM

This paper deals with the problem of coordinated spectrum sharing among secondary users in the context of TV white space (TVWS) spectrum. The proposed framework involves the use of auctions to allocate spectrum to users, which is a well-studied problem in the field of game theory and mechanism design (cs.GT). The paper also proposes an enhanced market-driven TVWS spectrum access model, which involves the use of a geolocation database to monitor and coordinate spectrum usage, and this involves the use of networking and information theory concepts (cs.NI, cs.IT). The paper also discusses the issue of interference-aware spectrum sharing, which is a key concern in the field of cryptography and network security (cs.CR). Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed framework using realistic TVWS spectrum availability maps and scenarios with real home distributions, which involves the use of multimedia and signal processing techniques (cs.MM).
